text: this isn't the real Sun this town in
Norway received no sunlight for half a
year from early October to mid-march
rukon Norway sat in permanent shadow
until a series of mirrors were built
2500 feet above the town in 2013 the
mirrors redirect the sun's light down on
to the town lighting up the town square
throughout the cold winter months since
then the mirrors have been great for the
town's tourism business but surprisingly
some locals haven't warmed up to the
idea dismissing the 850 thousand dollar
project as a tourist gimmick for my 27

with the rental duty the idea to use
